definition: (Buddhism) to be moved at the sight of good deeds/to join in charitable deeds/to tour temples
to follow/to comply with/varying according to.../to allow/subsequently
to be fond of/to like/to enjoy/to be happy/to feel pleased/happiness/delight/glad

sentences.english: Rejoice in other's successes to combat jealousy.
sentences.chinese: 隨喜他人成功以擊倒嫉妒。

sentences.english: We would do well to love and tolerate those who exceed us for in this way we will accomplish the virtue of this vow.
sentences.chinese: 能歡喜容忍別人超過自己，那隨喜的功德就殊勝了。

sentences.english: For renewing precepts, please bring your own precept robe. Donation for precept robes (US$25) is welcome.
sentences.chinese: 復戒者請自備縵衣，歡迎隨喜贊助縵衣$25。

sentences.english: I am really delighted by this child, who reminds me of unlimited life.
sentences.chinese: 真的很隨喜這個孩子，看到他，就想起無限生命。

definition: no end of virtuous achievements (idiom); boundless beneficence
to supply/to provide for one's elders/to support one's parents
gate to enlightment (Buddhism)/Buddhism/way/method/(old) south gate of a palace
chance/opportunity/predestined relationship/(Buddhist) principal and secondary causes/chain of cause and effect
to forge ahead vigorously/to dedicate oneself to progress
